title: TEDx: Emergence of an Alternate Path
description: Talk on the ethos of crowdfunding as a disruptive technology enabling grassroots innovation. Explored how technology adoption cycles create alternate paths for human progress and social transformation, with the core argument that some of the best innovations happen at the grassroots level through platforms like RocketHub.

title: Augmented Intelligence (AI)
venue: Real Estate Leaders Summit Â· Re.Comm.17 Â· KitzbÃ¼hel, Austria
description: Austrian press highlighted this as an elite gathering of 11 renowned international speakers to a select global invite-only audience of real estate and tech leaders hosted in Olympic Village KitzbÃ¼hel, Austria. Shared stage with Jimmy Wales (Wikipedia founder), Nigel Farage (UK politician), Mariana Mazzucato (UCL economist and author of "The Entrepreneurial State," advisor to governments worldwide), and Donald Sadoway (MIT Professor Emeritus, TIME 100 Most Influential People for his liquid metal battery work). Keynote examined human-AI collaboration and future intelligent systems.

title: The Future of Crowdfunding: What the Next 5 Years Will Bring
description: Talk exploring the evolving campaigning and social interaction landscape as well as predicting industry developments. Event dedicated to mobilization and engagement trends. Line up included global industry leaders in campaigning, politics, and social interaction.

title: Open Economy Fundamentals
description: Speaker at Belarus conference on open innovation. Explored open economies, crowdsourcing, and collaborative innovation in emerging markets and technology ecosystems.

title: World Crowdfunding Conference
description: Speaker and judge at this large-scale international forum drawing approximately 13,000 attendees including government dignitaries. Invited as a board member of the Crowdfunding Professional Association (CfPA) and based on industry experience at RocketHub as well as involvement in crowdfunding regulation development. Addressed the global state of crowdfunding and met with Chinese officials.

title: Hardware Innovation Workshop
description: Invite-only event hosted by Tim O'Reilly and Dale Dougherty at PARC in Palo Alto, featuring over 30 speakers from the hardware and maker ecosystem. Fellow speakers included Carl Bass (Autodesk President/CEO), Massimo Banzi (Arduino co-founder), Limor Fried (Adafruit founder), Nathan Seidle (SparkFun CEO), Ayah Bdeir (littleBits founder), Brad Feld (Foundry Group), Andrew "Bunnie" Huang (Chumby), and Mark Hatch (TechShop CEO). Panel on crowdfunding for hardware startups.
